title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2510.2 - Time for filing a PAR
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2510.2 - Time for filing a PAR
State Regulations
A PAR against an order of a rent administrator must be
filed in person, by mail, or as otherwise provided by operational bulletin with
the division within 35 days after the date such order is issued. A PAR served
by mail must be postmarked not more than 35 days after the date of such order, to be deemed timely filed. If the prepaid postage on the envelope in which the
PAR is mailed is by private postage meter, and the envelope does not have an
official U.S. Postal Service postmark, then the PAR will not be considered
timely filed unless received within the aforementioned 35 days or the
petitioner submits other adequate proof of mailing within said 35 days, such as
an official postal service receipt or certificate of mailing. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
2510.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
